001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.buildinfo;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonGetter;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonPropertyOrder;
007import org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime.DateTimeTriplet;
008
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.NavigableMap;
012
013/**
014 * This interface represents the build-information that is usually collected by build-tool
015 * into some dedicated text-resource, which are available in classpath at runtime.
016 */
017@JsonInclude(JsonInclude.Include.NON_EMPTY)
018@JsonPropertyOrder({
019    "maven-coordinates",
020    "resource-path",
021    "build-date-time",
022    "project-group",
023    "project-artifact",
024    "project-version",
025    "minimal-jdk-version",
026    "loading-errors",
027})
028public interface BuildInfo {
029
030    /**
031     * The path to resource that is used to represent the build-information
032     *
033     * @return either resource-path or any other reference to realize which resource was used for build-info
034     */
035    @JsonGetter("resource-path")
036    String getResourcePath();
037
038    /**
039     * Getting a sorted map of build-information properties (not dumped by default).
040     *
041     * @return build-information properties as {@link NavigableMap NavigableMap&lt;String,String&gt;}
042     */
043    @JsonIgnore
044    NavigableMap<String, String> getProjectProps();
045
046    /**
047     * Getting the value of maven-project group ({@code <groupId>}-tag in {@code pom.xml}),
048     * which must also be a part of {@link #getResourcePath() resource-path}.
049     *
050     * @return the value of maven-project group ({@code <groupId>}-tag in {@code pom.xml})
051     */
052    @JsonGetter("project-group")
053    String getProjectGroup();
054
055    /**
056     * Getting the value of maven-project artifact ({@code <artifactId>}-tag in {@code pom.xml}),
057     * which must also be a part of {@link #getResourcePath() resource-path}.
058     *
059     * @return the value of maven-project group ({@code <artifactId>}-tag in {@code pom.xml})
060     */
061    @JsonGetter("project-artifact")
062    String getProjectArtifact();
063
064    /**
065     * Getting the value of maven-project version ({@code <version>}-tag in {@code pom.xml}),
066     * which must also be a value of corresponding <b>{@code git}</b>-tag in {@code git}-repository.
067     *
068     * @return the value of maven-project group ({@code <artifactId>}-tag in {@code pom.xml})
069     */
070    @JsonGetter("project-version")
071    String getProjectVersion();
072
073    /**
074     * Getting the maven-coordinates - the colon({@code ':'})-separated {@link #getProjectGroup() project-group},
075     * {@link #getProjectArtifact() project-artifact} and {@link #getProjectVersion() project-version},
076     * <a href="https://gradle.org/">Gradle</a>-style identifier of any project and library.
077     *
078     * @return colon({@code ':'})-separated {@link #getProjectGroup() project-group},
079     *         {@link #getProjectArtifact() project-artifact} and {@link #getProjectVersion() project-version}
080     */
081    @JsonGetter("maven-coordinates")
082    default String getMavenCoordinates() {
083        return getProjectGroup() + ":" + getProjectArtifact() + ":" + getProjectVersion();
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * Getting the date-time when the project was built as {@link DateTimeTriplet}.
088     *
089     * @return the data-time, when the build was made, as {@link DateTimeTriplet}
090     */
091    @JsonIgnore
092    DateTimeTriplet getBuildDateTime();
093
094    /**
095     * Getting the build date-time without information about day of week,
096     * because in some cases the information about the day of week is not desired.
097     *
098     * @return formatted build date-time without information about day of week
099     */
100    @JsonGetter("build-date-time")
101    default String getBuildDateTimeStr() {
102        return getBuildDateTime() == null ? null : getBuildDateTime().dumpNoWeek();
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Getting the minimal supported version of JDK, where this library could be used
107     *
108     * @return minimal version of JDK, where this library could be used
109     */
110    @JsonGetter("minimal-java-version")
111    String getMinimalJavaVersion();
112
113    /**
114     * Getting the list of loading-errors that was happened on constructing the instance of this object.
115     * In normal scenario such list <u>must be empty!</u>
116     * 
117     * @return if not empty - the list of errors that were discovered when loading the resource-content
118     */
119    @JsonGetter("loading-errors")
120    default List<String> getLoadingErrors() {
121        return Collections.emptyList();
122    }
123}
